Eperience

Lead Coordinator

T9Hacks: A Women and Non-Binary Hackathon
2015 – 2019

Founded T9Hacks, an organization dedicated to providing events for students to learn and explore computing. Designed and ran interdisciplinary, hands-on, informal learning environment. Mixed-methods study involving ethnographic observation, feedback questionnaires, construct surveys, informal and structured interviews. Analyzed qualitative data, statistical analysis, data analysis. Explored areas such as competition, learning experiences, motivations and goals, and student experiences, event design, and program evaluation.

Worked as head of logistical coordination for 100+ participants and 50+ volunteers at three annual events. Developed technical and professional development workshops, event programming, and hands-on, supportive, and project-based learning experience for students. Worked to improve participant recruitment and retention. Secured corporate sponsorships and community partnerships. Created organizational structure: sponsorship, marketing and advertising, and logistics and event design/ux. Developed responsibilities and positions for roles; assisted in all areas.

Published/reported results: [Ref] [Ref] [Ref] [Ref] [Ref]

Graduate Researcher

University of Colorado Boulder
2015 – 2019

Worked on multiple qualitative research projects with increasing amounts of autonomy and ownership over the projects. Experience publishing results, writing reports and protocols. Conducted interviews, focus groups, ethnographic observation; surveys, questionnaires, assessments. Developed and improved data collector and data manager processes. Analyzed qualitative data, quantitative data, performed statistical analysis. Created infographics and visualizations.

Instructor/Teaching Assistant (TA)

University of Colorado Boulder
2014 – 2018

Taught 10+ introductory STEM classes. As primary instructor developed full curriculum and created course evaluations. Managed small teaching teams, managed weekly responsibilities of team of learning assistants. Worked with other educators to standardize curriculum.

Graduate Research Fellow (NSF)

The ECSITE Project: Engaging Computer Science in Traditional Education
2013 – 2015

This NSF GK-12 project incorporated computing into existing K-12 courses by working with local school districts to develop standards-based curriculum appropriate for each school. Developed interdisciplinary science/technology content for a targeted demographic. Collaborated with a middle school teacher to develop career exploration, computational thinking, environmental activist curricula for >200 8th grade students.

Volunteered as a board member of STEM outreach NPO. Assisted in program coordination for 4 schools/programs. Gathered volunteers, hosted events, coordinated with middle schools.
